docs.snippet: A Washington restaurant is reeling from menacing calls and online abuse after a fake story: that Hillary Clinton abuses children there.

headline.print_headline: Fact Check: This Pizzeria Is Not a Child-Trafficking Site
headline.main: Fake News Onslaught Targets Pizzeria as Nest of Child-Trafficking

docs.abstract: James Alefantis, owner of pizzeria Comet Ping Pong in Washington, DC, has been working with police and FBI to stop ceaseless onslaught of death threats and other abuse stemming from fake news story repeatedly shared through social media; says harassment began after dozens of made-up articles appeared online several days before presidential election claiming Hillary Clinton was abusing children in his restaurant; incident supports growing outcry that online platforms are letting fake news spread unchecked.

docs.snippet: A man said on Facebook that he was planning a Labor Day attack, comparing it to the Orlando nightclub massacre and killings of African-Americans by the police, the F.B.I. said.

headline.main: F.B.I. Arrests Florida Man Accused of Threatening to Kill Gays

docs.snippet: Putin’s policy is hard to distinguish from Obama’s. America’s capitulation is complete, with appalling results.
Tech companies love to hitch themselves to progressive causes, even if they’re beyond the industry’s grasp.

docs.snippet: The election of Donald J. Trump, the rise of Bernie Sanders, and the momentum behind Brexit and ISIS all show the newly global gravity of social media.

headline.main: The Tyranny of Other People’s Vacation Photos
